importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: This is the date of the news article's publication, marking when the public learned of Doug Martin's death and the police investigation related to a break-in in Oakland.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The incident occurred on Saturday, October 4, 2025, and the news was released on Monday, October 20, 2025, placing the key events within a short time window that highlights urgency and public concern over police interactions with individuals.

keyTakeAways: Former NFL running back Doug Martin died after a struggle with police during an arrest related to a break-in in Oakland.
Martin, a 36-year-old former All-Pro with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, was transported to the hospital and died; cause of death is not yet released.
The Oakland Police Department reported a 'brief struggle' during the detention, but no further details were provided.
Martin was a top NFL performer, including being the 31st overall pick in 2012, with career stats including 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns.
He was named first-team All-Pro and selected to the Pro Bowl in both 2013 and 2015.
Martin was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Tampa Bay Buccaneers franchise history.
The family requested privacy, and Oakland Mayor Barbara Lee and the Buccaneers expressed condolences.
An autopsy is planned to determine the cause of death, indicating ongoing investigation and public interest in the circumstances.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, known for his standout career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died after a brief struggle with Oakland police officers during an arrest related to a break-in at a home in Oakland on Saturday, October 4, 2025. He was 36 and had previously earned All-Pro honors and Pro Bowl selections. Though police reported only a brief struggle, the incident has sparked public concern over police use of force and accountability. The Oakland Police Department and Mayor Barbara Lee expressed condolences, and an autopsy has been ordered to determine the cause of death. The incident raises broader questions about law enforcement practices, especially in communities where athletes and residents live, and underscores the need for transparency in cases involving deaths during detentions.
title: Former NFL Player Doug Martin Dies After Struggle With Police During Arrest
